post_text:
10 minutes of your time can help inform how our state and our community is funded for the next 10 years.

Help improve your community with a click of a button.

Everyone living with you or sleeping at your home most of the time counts on the Census, even if they are not related to you. Make sure you count roommates, young children, newborns, and anyone staying in your home as of April 1.

Fill it out here: https://my2020census.gov/

post_text: Welcome back, Pack!
shared_text:
Weiss High School added 17 new photos to the album: First day of in-person instruction.
September 14 at 10:16 PM ·

Our in-person instruction students returned to campus today, meeting the Weiss faculty and staff for the first time in the 2020-21 school year. The day included student reunions, teachers instructing both virtually and in person, and lessons on safety procedures related to COVID-19, including social distancing and the wearing of masks.

post_text:
Pflugerville ISD Social Work Services led its annual school supply giveaway Wednesday at The Pfield. More than 880 school supplies were provided curbside style in backpacks to PfISD families on free or reduced meal programs. Pflugerville Education Foundation assisted in providing contributions as did private donors such as H-E-B, which donated hundreds of school supply kits.

The event marked the 15th year Social Work Services has provided free school supplies to PfISD schoolchildren.

Pflugerville ISD Social Work Services led its annual school supply giveaway Wednesday at The Pfield. More than 880 school supplies were provided curbside style in backpacks to PfISD families on free or reduced meal programs. Pflugerville Education Foundation assisted in providing contributions as did private donors such as H-E-B, which donated hundreds of school supply kits.

The event marked the 15th year Social Work Services has provided free school supplies to PfISD schoolchildren.

On Wednesday, Aug. 26, Pflugerville ISD Social Work Services will provide school supplies for students on free or reduced meal plans.

Supplies will be provided on the visitor’s side of The Pfield, 1440 W. Pecan St., from noon to 2 p.m. and 3-7 p.m.

The event will be drive-thru style and takes place while supplies last. Please remain in your vehicle, placing student school ID number, name and campus on the vehicle dashboard.

Reminder, the last day for families to grab free curbside meals is Wednesday, August 12th. PfISD will provide food services to the greatest extent possible and allowable for PFISD ENROLLED students participating in virtual learning. The first day of virtual learning meals will be provided at standard prices, reduced prices, or free depending on the student’s eligibility. Parents/guardians interested in applying for free or reduced meals must complete the 2020-2021 free & reduced meal application.

For more information please visit:

https://www.pfisd.net/Page/7894

post_text:
We want to see your Pfirst Day Face! 📸

Since we are virtual on our first day, pose your students in photos and send them our way by Monday, Aug. 10. We’ll share them on Facebook and Instagram on the first day of school, Aug. 13.

The deadline to submit your photos is: 8 p.m Monday, 8/10/20
(no late pictures will be accepted)

The rules to submit your child’s photo are below:
* Send picture to: Communications@pfisd.net OR tag us on Insta as “Pfirstday2020”
* Label the subject email: "PfirstDay2020"
* Please include name of student, grade and school in email
* Can include 1-2 photos, total, of each student
* parents are allowed in the photos
* Pose however you'd like!
* No masks needed! (as long as they are safely socially distanced)
* Please, no professional photos.

post_text:
🚨TODAY IS THE LAST DAY TO FILL OUT THE SURVEY🚨

Share your thoughts with us!

In preparation for the upcoming school year and the uncertainty of what the future holds, PfISD has created a Re-Entry Task Force to consider all of the district’s options while maintaining the safety and health of our students and staff members.

Please click on the link to the survey below in your native language to provide feedback. The survey will close on July 10, and the responses collected will be shared with the Re-Entry Task Force and used to help make recommendations to the Superintendent and PfISD Board of Trustees.

English: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/EngRTL
Spanish: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/SPARTL
Vietnamese: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/VietRTL

Attention PfISD parents:
A Food Services employee at Copperfield Elementary has tested positive for COVID-19, so meal distribution will be shut down at the site to allow for deep cleaning Monday.

The nearest meal distribution site to Copperfield is Dessau Middle School.

All Copperfield Food Services employees will be placed on a two-week quarantine, and a new crew will open the location on Tuesday morning.

post_text: Community members elected to Foundation board:
shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation
June 25 at 1:30 PM ·

Pflugerville Education Foundation is proud to announce the election to its board of directors for the upcoming board year Courtney Emken, Charlie Torres, and Dale "Woody" Woodkey.

Courtney Emken is the owner of DogBoys Dog Ranch in Pflugerville and has been an active supporter of the foundation’s work for many years.
Charlie Torres works with Communications Workers of America and has served as Chair of the School Health Advisory Council for Pflugerville ISD.
Dale "Woody" Woodkey is the president of Senior Living Transitions and has been actively involved with the foundation’s Golf Tournament for several years.

The foundation and its board members are excited to have these three strong community leaders join our team!
Please help us in welcoming them into their new board roles at Pflugerville Education Foundation.
text:
Community members elected to Foundation board:

Pflugerville Education Foundation
June 25 at 1:30 PM ·

Pflugerville Education Foundation is proud to announce the election to its board of directors for the upcoming board year Courtney Emken, Charlie Torres, and Dale "Woody" Woodkey.

Courtney Emken is the owner of DogBoys Dog Ranch in Pflugerville and has been an active supporter of the foundation’s work for many years.
Charlie Torres works with Communications Workers of America and has served as Chair of the School Health Advisory Council for Pflugerville ISD.
Dale "Woody" Woodkey is the president of Senior Living Transitions and has been actively involved with the foundation’s Golf Tournament for several years.

The foundation and its board members are excited to have these three strong community leaders join our team!
Please help us in welcoming them into their new board roles at Pflugerville Education Foundation.

Reminder:

PfISD and Aramark food services are proud to continue offering curbside meals to children this summer through the USDA summer meals program.

From Friday, May 29th through Tuesday, August 11th curbside pickup is available at select meal distribution sites at 8-9am or 11am to 1pm.

For more information on how to pick up meals and the PfISD summer meals program locations, please visit: https://www.pfisd.net/site/default.aspx?PageType=3&ModuleInstanceID=1130&ViewID=7b97f7ed-8e5e-4120-848f-a8b4987d588f&RenderLoc=0&FlexDataID=25276&PageID=1&fbclid=IwAR3hixb5pTRgL19Mw4v7HCLJt2UHUKidmqzDKrPUZfYzYoU_Qiz7Hh2PR-k

Reminder:

shared_text:
Pflugerville Library
May 27 at 9:46 PM ·

1,527! That's the number of books we were able to give away yesterday in our partnership with Pflugerville ISD for the Pflugerville Reads Project. School librarians, volunteers, and City of Pflugerville staff worked together at 10 campuses to distribute books to children and teens.

This project would not have been possible without the generosity of the Friends of the Pflugerville Library. As always, they were eager to encourage literacy and a love of reading in the community.

Although most campuses had enough books for everyone, we know that a couple campuses had unexpectedly high turnouts and ran out a few minutes early. We are looking into additional opportunities to give away more books over the summer. Keep an eye on our social media for future updates.

#PflugervilleStrong #pfisdreads #PflugervilleReads

This project would not have been possible without the generosity of the Friends of the Pflugerville Library. As always, they were eager to encourage literacy and a love of reading in the community.

post_text:
The Pflugerville, TX Municipal Government Public Library and Pflugerville Independent School District are partnering to get books into the homes of local children through the Pflugerville Reads Project.

Tuesday, PfISD parents picked up free books through the Pflugerville Reads Project during curbside meal pick-up. The books were collected through a combination of discounted bulk purchases and book donations from PfISD and the city library.

Pictured: Amanda Cawthon, Pflugerville Public Library youth services librarian, drops off books, provided to children for free through the Pflugerville Reads Project, in a chair during morning meal distribution Tuesday at Westview Middle School.

post_text:
The Pflugerville, TX Municipal Government Public Library and Pflugerville Independent School District are partnering to get books into the homes of local children through the Pflugerville Reads Project.

Tuesday, PfISD parents picked up free books through the Pflugerville Reads Project during curbside meal pick-up. The books were collected through a combination of discounted bulk purchases and book donations from PfISD and the city library.

The purchase of books was funded by the Friends of the Pflugerville Library, funds previously allocated to city library programs, and a stipend awarded by the 2020 Young Adult Reading Incentive Award.

post_text:
💻¡Devolución de computadoras!💻�

A medida que el año escolar llega a su fin, es hora de devolver todos las computadoras portátiles y/o hotspots del distrito que se les prestaron durante el cierre del distrito. Para conveniencia y seguridad, los padres o estudiantes, sin importar el nivel de grado escolar, pueden devolver sus computadoras portátiles a CUALQUIER escuela primaria entre las 8 a.m. y la 1 p.m. a partir del martes 26 de mayo y hasta el viernes 29 de mayo.

Esta será una entrega sin contacto. En los vestíbulos de cada escuela primaria se proveerán carritos y contenedores para dejarlos. Por favor, recuerden traer todos los artículos que se les hayan prestado, incluyendo cables y bolsas. Los estudiantes que se inscriban en la escuela de verano podrán conservar el dispositivo para la sesión de verano.

post_text:
💻DEVICE RETURN💻�
As the school year comes to a close, it is time to return all district laptops and/or hotspots that were borrowed during the district closure. Laptop return continues at all elementary campuses between 8 a.m. and 1 p.m. today through Friday May 29.

This will be a contactless drop-off. Carts and bins will be provided in the vestibules of each elementary campus for drop off. Please remember to bring all items checked out, including cables and bags. Students who register for summer school will be able to keep the device for the summer school session.

As the school year comes to a close, it is time to return all district laptops and/or hotspots that were borrowed during the district closure. Laptop return continues at all elementary campuses between 8 a.m. and 1 p.m. today through Friday May 29.

This will be a contactless drop-off. Carts and bins will be provided in the vestibules of each elementary campus for drop off. Please remember to bring all items checked out, including cables and bags. Students who register for summer school will be able to keep the device for the summer school session.

Ms Hughes at Brookhollow Elementary School is an AMAZING teacher in PfISD!

One nominee writes:
"From the minute that we found out that we were going to have to come up with a plan for remote learning, she set out to do just that. She literally came up with a plan for remote learning during spring break and found so many resources for us to use as a team. Every week, she single handedly puts together a digital learning plan and only asks for minimal assistance from the rest of us. She has delivered personal items to students and participated in drive by birthday celebrations for them as well. This is only her 2nd year of teaching!"

Thank you, Ms Hughes!

Pflugerville Education Foundation is at Parmer LaneElementary.
May 20 at 9:00 PM · Austin, TX ·

Ms Wright is an AMAZING teacher at Parmer Lane Elementary School!

One nominee writes:
"She makes individual packets for her students and goes to Westview to pass them out on Mondays. She does a snack time Zoom with her kids to help take care of their social and emotional needs. She has done home delivery of technology and materials for students who lack transportation. She works with her 4th-grade teacher team to increase all of their comfort with technology. She teaches lessons to kids in whatever way they can get to her. Even if that means being on the phone with them forever. She is truly kind and goes above and beyond for her kids. What makes her a superhero is that she does this all with 3 littles of her own at home."

Thank you Ms Wright for everything you do!!!

shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at WindermereElementary.
May 20 at 7:00 PM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Ms Gallegos is another AMAZING teacher at Windermere Elementary School!

One parent writes:
"Mrs. Gallegos has put together so many fun and exciting activities online for her Pegasus group, including Daily Circle Time, read-a-longs, virtual zoo and museum trips, pajama parties, show and tells, and more! She incorporates the entire Pegasus team and their beautiful smiles light up the screen each day to brighten my child's learning environment, even when he cannot be with his friends. Mrs. Gallegos has even hosted Zoom meetings with the whole class several times so that the children can see each other :) I love her enthusiasm and passion she has for these little minds. It inspires me as a fellow teacher and amazes me as a mother. She truly is a gift from God."

Thank you, Ms Gallegos!

post_text:
💻¡Devolución de computadoras!💻
A medida que el año escolar llega a su fin, es hora de devolver todos las computadoras portátiles y/o hotspots del distrito que se les prestaron durante el cierre del distrito. Para conveniencia y seguridad, los padres o estudiantes, sin importar el nivel de grado escolar, pueden devolver sus computadoras portátiles a CUALQUIER escuela primaria entre las 8 a.m. y la 1 p.m. a partir del martes 26 de mayo y hasta el viernes 29 de mayo.

Esta será una entrega sin contacto. En los vestíbulos de cada escuela primaria se proveerán carritos y contenedores para dejarlos. Por favor, recuerden traer todos los artículos que se les hayan prestado, incluyendo cables y bolsas. Los estudiantes que se inscriban en la escuela de verano podrán conservar el dispositivo para la sesión de verano.

post_text:
💻DEVICE RETURN💻
As the school year comes to a close, it is time to return all district laptops and/or hotspots that were borrowed during the district closure. For convenience and to ensure safety, parents or students, regardless of grade level, can return their laptops to ANY elementary campus between 8 a.m. and 1 p.m. beginning Tuesday, May 26 through Friday May 29.

This will be a contactless drop-off. Carts and Bins will be provided in the vestibules of each elementary campus for drop off. Please remember to bring all items checked out, including cables and bags. Students who register for summer school will be able to keep the device for the summer school session.

Please remember to bring all items checked out, including cables and bags. Students who register for summer school will be able to keep the device for the summer school session.

post_text:
AMAZING TEACHERS LIVE HERE:
The Pflugerville Education Foundation last week awarded 30 Amazing Educator Awards to PfISD educators. Each winner received a special delivery from the PEF Board and staff on Friday, May 15, as well as yard signs and Crumbl cookies. The Foundation received over 350 nominations.
shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at MurchisonElementary.
May 20 at 1:00 PM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Mr Matus is an AMAZING teacher at Murchison Elementary School!

One parent writes:
"Thanks to the nature of e-learning, however, I’ve been able to, as a parent, observe the extraordinary effort Mr. Matus has given to supporting his 4th grade students during this time at home. He conducts Zoom meetings twice each week to explain math lessons and answer questions. Another zoom meeting each week is dedicated to fun. Wacky Wednesday meetings have themes like decades day or favorite sport. He even invites guests like our PE coach to make special appearances. Finally, he holds a weekly zoom meeting for his GT kids. He gives them special challenges, but mostly I hear him complimenting their effort, giving advice on things like college and pointing out their individual talents. This isn’t teaching, it’s an extraordinary act of dedication to filling their hearts and not just their heads. The silver lining to this pandemic is getting to witness Mr. Matus’s love for kids and investing in their future."

Thank you, Mr Matus!!!

shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at Mott Elementary School.
May 20 at 1:00 AM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Mott Elementary School has AMAZING teachers like Ms Hughes!

"She always looks for ways to make learning real for the kids. She has made our science curriculum very interactive and even prepared all the supplies we have needed for the experiments to do in class. Even during our lockdown she has created a Zoom classroom where students can learn and interact together. She inspired me to do the same in my class.
She has helped our entire second grade team learn how to use Google Classroom as well as Zoom. She has helped all of the other teachers in creating documents as well. Her students and co workers love her."

Way to go Ms Hughes!!!

shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is with Christie Spencer Garrett at Kelly Lane Middle.
May 19 at 11:00 PM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Ms Garrett at Kelly Lane Middle School is an AMAZING teacher!

"Ms. Garrett absolutely goes above and beyond any teacher I have seen or worked with in my 8+yrs with our district. She reaches out to support students with academics but also support them emotionally. She offers extra time, support and care for helping her students as well as any student asking to find ways to be successful. Through the Covid pendemic, she created a flexible schedule to help students find structure when they so desperately needed it. She regularly reaches out and collaborates with parents, counselors, and myself to find ways to meet the multidimensional needs of students - she puts her time, patience plus heart and soul into helping guide students to be successful."

Thank you, Ms Garrett!

shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at Highland ParkElementary.
May 19 at 9:00 PM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Ms Lane is one of our AMAZING teachers at Highland Park!

One nominee writes:
"Mrs. Lane is always available to help! She offers live zoom lessons and "office hours" for students to ask questions daily. She has made very engaging activities and assignments that are DOABLE for students and parents (not adding extra stress or an unreasonable amount of time to complete). She has organized a parent meeting to help us all feel connected and cared for, as well as to ask questions. She communicates regularly, and we can always tell that she truly loves her students and misses them terribly. She is Amazing!"

Thank you, Ms Lane!

Pflugerville Education Foundation is at Hendrickson High School.
May 19 at 7:00 PM · Pflugerville, TX ·

Ms Lindgren is one of our AMAZING teachers at Hendrickson High School!!!

"Another example of Mrs. Lindgren's excellence has been shown as the world and our communities have been effected by Covid-19. During this time she has personally setup times on her own, to deliver laptops, paper packets, and items needed by families while we have had to move to remote learning. Each week she identifies students who need extended time with academic course work and works with them beyond the school day and hours to ensure that they are not falling behind. Her work ethic, self-starting mentality, and selflessness is what makes her an extraordinary teacher!"

Thank you Ms Lindgren!

One nominee writes:
"Dr. Melton was what I would consider a technophobe prior to COVID-19. She has not only embraced Google Classroom by watching videos on how to improve that experience, but she has embraced technology enough to follow my lead and build a remediation website for our failing 6th grade science students to help them pass for the year. She's so excited now, she'll be making websites for next year's units!"

Thank you Dr. Melton!

Snacks have made their mark on our menu and are here to stay! Join us for free curbside grab and go meals Monday through Friday 8 AM-9 AM or 11 AM-1 PM for up to four well balanced nutritious meals. Meals are available to anyone 18 or younger at 10 district feeding sites.

Details: https://www.pfisd.net/Domain/92

*Per TDA guidelines Kelly Lane Middle School does not qualify to serve dinners and snacks at this time.

post_text:
PfISD had the privilege to recognize two teachers in our district. Each one was presented the PfISD Coin of Excellence!

• Melissa Issaac CMS
• Coach Eugene Sykes CMS

Melissa Issaac’s dedication and commitment to students has been instrumental in their development. Melissa has gone above and beyond by providing support, instruction and mentorship not only to her students but to all students she meets. She is always there for students at any time. Her actions reflect great credit upon herself, Cele Middle School and PfISD.

Coach Sykes was presented the PfISD coin of excellence as well. Coach Sykes’ teaching, coaching and mentoring is the epitome of others to emulate. Coach Sykes’ ability to connect with all students has resulted in a great role model for students. His compassion and care for students has a direct impact on all students. Coach Sykes’s ability to lead by example significantly contributes to health and well-being of all students.

shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at Dearing Elementary School.
May 19 at 3:00 PM · Round Rock, TX ·

Ms Draughn from Dearing Elementary School is another AMAZING teacher in PfISD!

One parent writes:
"One of my saddest realizations through this pandemic was that we’d be missing out in being in her class for the rest of the traditional school year. In true Ms. Draughn fashion, she made her way to each student’s home to check on them, from a safe distance of course. It meant so much to our family. With much grace, she has adapted to our new way of learning and continues to engage the students and be the solid educator that she has proven to be."

Thank you Ms Draughn!!!

post_text: The Pflugerville Education Foundation last week awarded 30 Amazing Educator Awards to PfISD educators. Each winner received a special delivery from the PEF Board and staff on Friday, May 15, as well as yard signs and Crumbl cookies. The Foundation received over 350 nominations.
shared_text:
Pflugerville Education Foundation is at CopperfieldElementary.
May 19 at 1:00 PM · Austin, TX ·

Ms Olivarez is another AMAZING teacher at Copperfield Elementary School!
One nominee (out of several) wrote:
"Ms Olivarez constantly finds innovative and creative avenues to serve her students impacting positive outcomes for the individual, the class, the school and PfISD! To promote college awareness and readiness, she realized, on her Title 1 campus, her students did NOT have t-shirts to wear...she contacted universities across the state and nation. Enough shirts were donated for the school. Similarly, seeing other campuses where students on the 1st day of school donned NEW backpacks and her students did not, she contacted Corporate CEO's and was blessed to receive backpacks for the campus. Additionally, she found an opportunity to place NEW appropriate reading level books in each backpack. Upon personally receiving HEB gift cards, she immediately divided them among Copperfield families needing food during this pandemic. She is a jewel a mentor, a motivator with STELLAR ideas and tireless action."

Thank you, Ms Olivarez for everything you do for Copperfield & the PfISD community!
text:
The Pflugerville Education Foundation last week awarded 30 Amazing Educator Awards to PfISD educators. Each winner received a special delivery from the PEF Board and staff on Friday, May 15, as well as yard signs and Crumbl cookies. The Foundation received over 350 nominations.

Pflugerville Education Foundation is at CopperfieldElementary.
May 19 at 1:00 PM · Austin, TX ·

Ms Olivarez is another AMAZING teacher at Copperfield Elementary School!
One nominee (out of several) wrote:
"Ms Olivarez constantly finds innovative and creative avenues to serve her students impacting positive outcomes for the individual, the class, the school and PfISD! To promote college awareness and readiness, she realized, on her Title 1 campus, her students did NOT have t-shirts to wear...she contacted universities across the state and nation. Enough shirts were donated for the school. Similarly, seeing other campuses where students on the 1st day of school donned NEW backpacks and her students did not, she contacted Corporate CEO's and was blessed to receive backpacks for the campus. Additionally, she found an opportunity to place NEW appropriate reading level books in each backpack. Upon personally receiving HEB gift cards, she immediately divided them among Copperfield families needing food during this pandemic. She is a jewel a mentor, a motivator with STELLAR ideas and tireless action."

Thank you, Ms Olivarez for everything you do for Copperfield & the PfISD community!

May 19 at 12:59 AM · Pflugerville, TX ·

The first AMAZING PfISD teacher we would like to recognize is Ms Francis from Cele Middle School!!!
Here is what one nominee had to say:
"When the district started doing remote learning, she was immediately learning and teaching all of the Science Dept and other teachers at Cele that needed assistance. She was highly motivated to show teachers how she would be preparing and providing lessons that would keep all of our students completely engaged and learning! Mrs. Francis was also utilizing new apps and software that would help and keep all types of learners academically engaged. She is extremely dedicated to the district, too. She has assisted the Science Dept in writing curriculum and creating assignments."

Thank you Ms Francis!

HHS Hawk Pride added 38 new photos to the album: HHS Softball vs. Westwood: Senior Day.
May 6 at 7:26 PM ·

Before COVID-19 put a sudden halt on our season, we took on Westwood on a cloudy afternoon on March 14.

We were able to celebrate our seniors that day in what turned out to be their final game in a Hawks uniform, and we got them a W!

Plus, Benji Garcia was in the booth and on camera to do interviews with CBS Austin for a story about him that would air later!

post_text:
PfISD invites all families who still need a technology device to pick up one this week at one of three locations.

Having completed our initial device distributions, we are pleased to be able to offer additional devices to families in need. The distribution of these devices are now available on the following dates:

Wednesday, April 29 – Connally High School, 10 a.m. – 2 p.m.

Thursday, April 30 – Weiss High School, 3 – 6 p.m.

Friday, May 1 – Timmerman Elementary School, 10 a.m. – 2 p.m.

Interested students or families may come to any location during the scheduled time to receive a device. All they are required to provide is a valid PfISD Student ID number clearly visible in the window. Please note, there are a limited number of devices and they will be available on a first-come, first-served basis.

post_text:
Great News! Starting Friday, April 17, families visiting any of 10 PfISD meal delivery sites may pick up meals for that day, as well as two extra breakfast and lunch meals per child.

Weekend meals will be served at meal delivery locations from 8-9 a.m. and 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. each Friday beginning April 17. Meals will be provided curbside at the locations above.

Children must be 18 years old or younger. Parents or guardians may pick up meals with or without children present, but identification will be required for children not present at pick-up.

Parents/guardians may only pick up meals for their own children. For more information go to: http://ow.ly/bj8F50zg6h9

post_text:
The 2020 Greater Austin High School Musical Theatre Awards ceremony was slated to take place tonight in Austin, but was cancelled due to COVID-19.

Celebrate the outstanding work of our Fine Arts theater students and staff tonight, as we await the naming of the winners online, on May 31!

Click below to see PfISD campus GAHSMTA 2020 nominees, previously announced:
shared_text:
Weiss High School
April 16 at 12:20 AM ·

The 2020 Greater Austin High School Musical Theatre Awards were supposed to be presented tonight in a ceremony at The Long Center in Austin. COVID-19 put a damper on things but that doesn’t mean we weren’t nominated for awards! So tonight, we celebrate, and invite you to sing along with us!

Weiss High School: “Disney’s The Little Mermaid”

Nominated for GAHSMTA 2020 in:
• Best Direction
• Best Featured Performer (Isaiah Choice)
• Best Musical Direction
• Best Orchestra
• Best Actress in a Supporting Role (Maya Albert)
• Best Costume Design
• Best Ensemble
• Best Actress in a Leading Role (McKenlee Wilson, Naomi Taylor)
• Best Choreography
• Best Production
text:
The 2020 Greater Austin High School Musical Theatre Awards ceremony was slated to take place tonight in Austin, but was cancelled due to COVID-19.

Celebrate the outstanding work of our Fine Arts theater students and staff tonight, as we await the naming of the winners online, on May 31!

Click below to see PfISD campus GAHSMTA 2020 nominees, previously announced:

Weiss High School
April 16 at 12:20 AM ·

The 2020 Greater Austin High School Musical Theatre Awards were supposed to be presented tonight in a ceremony at The Long Center in Austin. COVID-19 put a damper on things but that doesn’t mean we weren’t nominated for awards! So tonight, we celebrate, and invite you to sing along with us!

Weiss High School: “Disney’s The Little Mermaid”

Nominated for GAHSMTA 2020 in:
• Best Direction
• Best Featured Performer (Isaiah Choice)
• Best Musical Direction
• Best Orchestra
• Best Actress in a Supporting Role (Maya Albert)
• Best Costume Design
• Best Ensemble
• Best Actress in a Leading Role (McKenlee Wilson, Naomi Taylor)
• Best Choreography
• Best Production

post_text:
The Pfund Pfamilies in Need Challenge is underway and we are thrilled with the response so far! We couldn't be prouder of our community as we all come together to assist PfISD students and their families during their time of need. Can you help us provide basic needs like food, diapers, and formula to families in your area? We are striving to match the Pflugerville Education Foundations grant of $10,000! Can you help us meet this goal? The final day for donations of any kind is on Friday, April 24th.

Ways you can help:
💵Monetary donation
🥫In-kind donation
✋Volunteer your time
📩Share this post on your timeline and tag 3 friends

For more information on the challenge and how you can help, please visit:
(https://conta.cc/3c0xgkg)

post_text:
Just because prom is canceled doesn’t mean you can’t have a good time with your friends. It’s time for imPROMptu!

Get together virtually and host prom from home! Invite your crew and more of your classmates if you like to have the best prom possible through video conference! (But keep your invite and chat room info private!!) Plan ahead and find a time your crew can all get together for your imPROMptu. Assign tasks to your friends to make sure everything will be memorable.

Post photos getting ready and use #imPROMptuPfISD. Your hair and makeup won’t do themselves! And guys, your social distancing beard won’t fall off on its own.

Hit the Red Carpet! Reveal your outfit to all your friends with your own fun virtual fashion show.

Order in your favorite dinner, eat and chat with your friends and then….

DANCE! Turn on the music and dance with your friends in your homemade prom.

(At this time there are no plans to reschedule proms; however, we will always consider how we might provide this experience to our students should the opportunity present itself.)

shared_text:
Pflugerville Police Department
April 13 at 2:50 PM ·

According to www.2020census.gov, Census takers may visit homes in Pflugerville during April to conduct quality check interviews and then in mid-May to collect responses.

How to identify a Census worker: They will have a valid ID badge with their photo on it, a US Department of Commerce watermark, and expiration date. If in doubt, call the regional census center for Pflugerville which is 972-510-1800.

Note that no Census taker will ask for your social security number or about your citizenship.

Are you ready to rise to the challenge? 💪 It has been a time of uncertainty amidst the COVID-19 outbreak and due to this, many families within the PfISD community do not have access to basic needs to thrive during this challenging time. There are several ways you can help and your tax-deductible donation will be matched by the Pflugervillle Education Foundation with a $10,000 grant. We can meet our community challenge to provide students and their families with necessities that are not as readily available during this crisis, with your help.

Ways you can help:
💵Monetary donation
🥫In-kind donation
✋Volunteer your time
📩Share this post on your timeline and tag 3 friends

For more information on the challenge and how you can help, please visit http://ow.ly/3QnR50za4m6

post_text: Texas, remember the importance of social distancing. If you must go out, avoid public spaces and keep your distance from others (at least 6 feet). If we continue to follow valuable public health guidance, fewer of our friends & family will be affected by COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas
text: Texas, remember the importance of social distancing. If you must go out, avoid public spaces and keep your distance from others (at least 6 feet). If we continue to follow valuable public health guidance, fewer of our friends & family will be affected by COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas

post_text: #COVID19 lives on droplets in the lungs of people with the virus, even if they don’t have symptoms. When infected people breathe, the virus enters the air. If you can’t #StayHome, wear a mask/scarf/bandana, stay 6 feet apart, and wash your hands. #DontGoViral
text: #COVID19 lives on droplets in the lungs of people with the virus, even if they don’t have symptoms. When infected people breathe, the virus enters the air. If you can’t #StayHome, wear a mask/scarf/bandana, stay 6 feet apart, and wash your hands. #DontGoViral

post_text: Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.
text: Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.

post_text:
Keep your children engaged and learning with our remote learning options! 💻📝
PfISD is offering remote learning options while we are away from the classroom. If your student has access to a computer and internet, they can access our remote learning resources at: https://sites.google.com/pfisd.net/pfisdremotelearning/home

If your student does not have access to a computer or internet, there are a couple of options: The first is paper-based plans that can be picked up at any of our district meal locations. The completed assignments can be returned the following Monday at the district meal pickups. Make sure to fill out your child’s information on the cover sheet so we can route it to the correct campus/teacher!

If your student does not have access to an electronic device or Internet, please use one of the links below to apply for technology assistance.
English Access Survey : https://forms.gle/iFBapTtCJGczPmWaA
Spanish Access Survey : https://forms.gle/9h1DRgpgF4Lsn5QW9
Vietnamese Access Survey:https://forms.gle/Fq8zAjsumAPc7xHQ6

We continue to closely monitor updates and are in communication with local health departments. Additional school closures have not been decided at this time. We will provide more updates as they become available. All our communication regarding this situation can be found at pfisd.net/coronavirus.

post_text:
The natural world is a giant, open-ended learning laboratory. Children are innate scientists and love to experience the sights, scents, sounds and textures of the outdoors. Nature provides countless opportunities for discovery, creativity, problem-solving, and STEM education.

Interacting with natural environments allows children to learn by doing and experiment with ideas, to connect with the peacefulness of nature, and allows for physical activity contributing positively to a child’s overall fitness.

Spend some time outdoors today, and allow your child to explore. Remember to make learning fun!

shared_text:
Pflugerville Elementary School
March 31 at 12:30 PM ·

Hello Pflugerville Elementary community!
Coronavirus, COVID, Stay Home! Oh, my!
All these sudden changes to our lives can leave our heads spinning, and our children stressed out. To help out, your favorite art teacher, Ms. Brianna Alizzi of PES, put together a series of mindfulness activity videos, for students and parents alike to get into the right frame of mind. We hope you enjoy! Today, we post the first in the series. Look out for more from Ms. Alizzi in the coming days!

shared_text:
Mott Elementary School
March 29 at 6:41 PM ·

We are excited to start our first week of remote learning. You should have heard from your child’s teacher at least once this past week... it could have been email, dojo, seesaw, bloomz, etc. Please reach out to your child’s teacher or the administrators if you have not heard from your child’s teacher.

Our grade level teams have collaborated on lessons for the week that teachers will be sharing with families through various platforms (email, Google classroom, Seesaw,etc).
If you do not have access to technology for your student to use for the lessons, PfISD will also have printed lesson activities available for pick-up at the food locations across the district (KLMS is closest to Mott; 8-9am and 11am-1pm).

Most importantly, we miss our Owls! We hope you are doing everything necessary to stay healthy, physically and emotionally. Please reach out to an administrator, counselor, or social worker if you have needs we can help with.
Tammy Rebecek, Adrian Tristan, Sarah Boyle, Reagan Portillo, Karen Reyes, and Janett Rodriguez.

post_text:
As the supervising adult for remote learning, you will be more a teacher's aide or facilitator rather than a replacement teacher. While your child's teacher will provide your student with instruction, it is helpful to know what the state requires for each school level.

The Texas Education Agency offers curriculum requirements for each subject. You can learn more here: https://tea.texas.gov/academics/subject-areas

If your child is finding a particular task difficult, be available to make suggestions and answer questions, but try to let them do things themselves as much as possible. If you don't know the answer, work with your child to discover a solution.

And don't forget to make learning fun!

post_text:
Rest assured your teachers are working hard to provide you with the best learning experiences possible, and technology may be a part of that experience. Several Internet providers have announced they will make services available for free for households with grades K-12.
Spectrum will offer free broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription and at any service level up to 100 Mbps. To enroll call 1 (866) 874-2389. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.
text:
Rest assured your teachers are working hard to provide you with the best learning experiences possible, and technology may be a part of that experience. Several Internet providers have announced they will make services available for free for households with grades K-12.
Spectrum will offer free broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription and at any service level up to 100 Mbps. To enroll call 1 (866) 874-2389. Installation fees will be waived for new student households.

post_text:
We can spare more than a square. 🧻

TODAY ONLY!! The district will also be distributing ONE roll of toilet paper to each family during the lunch pick-up service at our 10 campus locations providing food services during the closure.

We are so excited to see so many of you taking advantage of the grab-and-go breakfast and lunch offered at these 10 campuses.

The district has also updated its practices regarding the food services during the school closure. Children are no longer required to be present for adults to pick up meals. The TDA made changes to its policies and procedures last night and PfISD will adopt them as well.

post_text:
Make sure your children do not just see this as an extended holiday but as normal school, from home. It’s important to create a structure.
Traditional schools have a timetabled structure throughout the week, so rather than disrupting your child’s routine, you might wish to follow your child’s school routine.
There is no specific time students should spend studying. However, students of different ages will complete tasks and grasp concepts at different rates. Be flexible and understanding, and remember to make learning fun.

Also, on Thursday, we will provide information to parents regarding instructional support at home. Stay safe!

Wieland Elementary PFISD
March 25 at 12:11 AM ·

Our drive was amazing. The route got a little confusing and we looped around a little. I know we missed a few families who were out looking for us and we are so sorry we didn’t get to honk and wave at you. One family tracked us down after we circled back to try to find them. This second grader (along with her brother, a future Wieland student) waited outside and they ended up bringing a parade to us! It was awesome to see them.

post_text: Dessau Middle students are tutoring family members today:
shared_text:
Dessau Middle School
March 23 at 10:34 PM ·

“Diamondback family, please know that each and every one of you and your families are heavy in our thoughts.
At DMS we care deeply for our students and staff. We believe that it is also important to guide students to do the same and to model it through our daily actions. It is in trying times that our very best can shine and that our bond is the strongest.
In an effort to continue inspiring students and each other to reach and surpass our greatness, we are sharing a daily activity for each day of the week. Our Spirit Week daily activities are attached.
Let’s make it even more inspiring by sharing photos of you doing the activities in the comments.
With great sincerity and deep gratitude for each one of you, stay safe, your DMS family."

post_text:
Dear PfISD Community,

We are cancelling track meets for middle school today. The weather doesn’t look like it is getting any better, and the wind chill will not rise above 45 degrees. We want to ensure we follow the following guidelines:

• Wind chill factor 39 to 45 degrees (with precipitation)
• 35 minutes of exposure/20 minutes inside (may return outside after 20 minutes)
• 35 minutes of exposure/20 minutes inside
• Dry clothing (socks, gloves)
• Athletes must be dressed in warm‐ups with extremities covered

Thank you for your patience and understanding of this matter.

shared_text:
Code2College
February 17 at 5:17 PM ·

Yes, those are Golden Tickets . . . but the opportunities in store for our students are far more life-changing than a visit to a chocolate factory.

Each year, our Executive Director makes a visit to each of our partner schools to invite the top performing students in the program to interview for a Code2College Summer internship. This year, Code2College will be placing high school students at twenty different companies in the Austin area for 8-12 week paid, technical Summer internships in software engineering, IT and other high-demand roles. And yes that’s right, these are high schoolers, ages 15-18!

These are just a few of our golden ticket holders from Manor ISD, Harmony Austin, Austin ISD, Pflugerville ISD, Del Valle ISD, and Round Rock ISD!

Please join us congratulating these all-star students on this tremendous achievement and wish them the best as they prepare for their upcoming interviews!

#MondayMotivation #diversityintech

post_text:
Pflugerville ISD hosted its 12th annual Geography Showcase on Feb. 1 at PHS.

7th grader Adam Duong of Park Crest Middle School captured 1st place overall. 8th grader Taylor Hayes from Kelly Lane Middle School and 4th grader Evan Dossett of Windermere Elementary School finished 2nd and 3rd, respectively.

The Geography Showcase celebrates geography education in grades 4-8. The contestants, all campus winners of the National Geographic Bee competition, answer questions about local, state, national and world geography.

Campus winners also took a qualifying test in hopes of participating in the state contest on March 27. Winners at the state level advance to the National Geographic Bee in Washington, D.C. in May.
text:

The Geography Showcase celebrates geography education in grades 4-8. The contestants, all campus winners of the National Geographic Bee competition, answer questions about local, state, national and world geography.

Campus winners also took a qualifying test in hopes of participating in the state contest on March 27. Winners at the state level advance to the National Geographic Bee in Washington, D.C. in May.

post_text:
The Central Texas area is anticipating a cold front moving into the area tonight along with potential freezing rain overnight. We will continue to monitor the weather to determine if any changes will need to be made to the school day. Please continue to check the district’s website and social media for any changes.

We will provide an update if there are any changes made to the school day.

Additionally, the district will activate the call-out system to all parents and provide information to the local media if any changes are made to the school day.

Pflugerville Education Foundation is with Clint Fletcher and 2 others.
February 3 at 10:41 PM ·

We’d like to extend our sincerest appreciation to those who turned out to support The Pflugerville Education Foundation Galaxy Gala on Saturday at the Courtyard by Marriott Pflugerville. We’d also like to congratulate the staff of Brookhollow Elementary, which captured the top prize in our Out of This World talent show, with an other-worldly performance.

The time and energy spent will go toward the support of the education of our community’s young learners. Our thanks again, to one and all who contributed in some way.

One of the amazing events DMS students took place in before we let out for our winter break was the Chess Tournament sponsored by Mr. Bearden and our Chess Club. It featured a grand scale chess board on our gym floor with real-life chess pieces played by students and staff.

Pflugerville ISD added 8 new photos.
December 16, 2019 at 7:36 PM ·

Pflugerville ISD leadership broke ground on the future site of the new PfISD elementary and middle school Monday.

Community members, city officials, Webber construction and employees from PBK and Pfluger architects gathered to celebrate the growth of Pflugerville ISD.

Superintendent of Schools Dr. Killian expressed thanks to the community and voters who helped pass the 2018 bond.

For more information about bond dollars at work, visit pfisdbond.net.

post_text:
TWO HOUR DELAY Tuesday, November 12 | WEATHER ADVISORY: Pflugerville ISD has implemented a 2-hour delay today due to anticipated weather conditions. Although the roads are primarily dry at this time, there is the possibility of a late dusting of precipitation between now and 6 a.m. that would affect morning traffic.

Buses will operate their regular bus routes two hours later than their usual time. The school day will end at the regular time. Please make arrangements for students in the morning as school personnel will not be on campuses until the delayed start time.

Please continue to monitor District communication channels, if weather conditions worsen the District will provide updated information about school and District operations.
text:
TWO HOUR DELAY Tuesday, November 12 | WEATHER ADVISORY: Pflugerville ISD has implemented a 2-hour delay today due to anticipated weather conditions. Although the roads are primarily dry at this time, there is the possibility of a late dusting of precipitation between now and 6 a.m. that would affect morning traffic.

Buses will operate their regular bus routes two hours later than their usual time. The school day will end at the regular time. Please make arrangements for students in the morning as school personnel will not be on campuses until the delayed start time.

Please continue to monitor District communication channels, if weather conditions worsen the District will provide updated information about school and District operations.

Pflugerville ISD added 51 new photos.
November 11, 2019 at 10:50 PM ·

Pflugerville ISD Transportation department held a flag raising ceremony and veteran award ceremony Monday.

Transportation staff who served in the military were awarded plaques in honor of their service. Superintendent of Schools Dr. Doug Killian and Board President Vernagene Mott presented the awards.

The American and Texas flags were raised for the first time on the newly constructed flag pole in front of the transportation building.

Many thanks to the Hendrickson Hawk Band who performed patriotic tunes during the event.

We are grateful for our district veterans!

post_text:
It’s true – breakfast is the most important meal of the day! Skipping it can deprive students of the ‘brain fuel’ they need to focus and succeed in class. To start the day right, eating a healthy breakfast within two hours of waking up and including a combination of healthy fats, proteins and carbohydrates is the recipe for their success!

As moms, dads and guardians, having information like this at our fingertips from experienced chefs and dietitians is so important. Join and sign up for healthy cooking ideas and nutrition news to help feed your families’ potential. Just click on ‘join’ to sign up for free at FYP365.com!

To start the day right, eating a healthy breakfast within two hours of waking up and including a combination of healthy fats, proteins and carbohydrates is the recipe for their success!

As moms, dads and guardians, having information like this at our fingertips from experienced chefs and dietitians is so important. Join and sign up for healthy cooking ideas and nutrition news to help feed your families’ potential. Just click on ‘join’ to sign up for free at FYP365.com!

Copperfield Elementary School
October 4, 2019 at 5:41 PM ·

Our thanks to Walmart Store 3569 and Pepsi for their generous donations to Copperfield this morning! Walmart and Pepsi representatives dropped off three pallets of school supplies and Gatorade, as well as a check for $2,000! PfISD Board President Vernagene Mott joined educator Margaret Olivarez, who spearheaded the donation with Walmart Store Manager Gerry Moreno, in a presentation attended by Copperfield students and staff.

shared_text:
Pflugerville ISD added 9 new photos.
September 27, 2019 at 5:35 PM ·

Two valuable members of the Police Department who have recently retired were recognized for their years of service to Pflugerville ISD at the board meeting Thursday.

Cora, an 8.5-year-old German shepherd served as the explosive detection dog for six years with PfISD. Cora is a veteran of the Austin bomber incident and supported U.S. Postal Inspectors, the Travis County Sheriff Office and the Pflugerville Police Department. Cora’s handler is Officer Bobby Wilson.

Roy, an 8.5-year-old golden retriever/lab served as a Narcotics K9 with PfISD for six years. Roy was selected by a student as her favorite staff member. Roy and his handler, Officer Ramon Garcia were recognized on the field at her soccer game.

Both canines plan to enjoy their retirement by chasing the cat, being pampered and home relaxing with other dog friends.
text:
Pflugerville ISD added 9 new photos.
September 27, 2019 at 5:35 PM ·

Two valuable members of the Police Department who have recently retired were recognized for their years of service to Pflugerville ISD at the board meeting Thursday.

Cora, an 8.5-year-old German shepherd served as the explosive detection dog for six years with PfISD. Cora is a veteran of the Austin bomber incident and supported U.S. Postal Inspectors, the Travis County Sheriff Office and the Pflugerville Police Department. Cora’s handler is Officer Bobby Wilson.

Roy, an 8.5-year-old golden retriever/lab served as a Narcotics K9 with PfISD for six years. Roy was selected by a student as her favorite staff member. Roy and his handler, Officer Ramon Garcia were recognized on the field at her soccer game.

Both canines plan to enjoy their retirement by chasing the cat, being pampered and home relaxing with other dog friends.

shared_text:
Pflugerville ISD added 8 new photos.
September 27, 2019 at 5:27 PM ·

Murchison Elementary 5th grade students led the pledges of Allegiance to the United States and Texas at the board meeting Thursday.

The land agreement partnership between Travis County ESD No. 2 and PfISD was also included in board recognitions. PfISD will transfer three acres of land near Weiss High School to the ESD for construction of a sixth fire station.

The Pflugerville Education Foundation is seeking volunteers for its annual Schoolhouse Scramble Golf Tourney on October 3, 2019 at Star Ranch Golf Course. You can be part of a fun event that provides funds for student scholarships and grants for innovation in the classroom! A variety of positions and shifts are available. Contact Marie Felan, Executive Director, by email at Tina.felan@pfisd.net.
